string.name: intro_answer
string.ul:
•
For the past 2 months and a half, I have been given the opportunity to be a part of the POS team and get a first look at our the new system for Taco Bell.
 
•
I have had the opportunity to learn about Android, Git, Kotlin and much more!
 
•
I want to introduce and teach you all quickly about all the things Ive learned so far.

string.name: self_intro_answer
string.ul:
•
I attend the University of Wisconsin-Madison.

I will be going into my senior year, graduating Fall 2022.
 
•
I study computer Engineering and Computer Science.
 
•
I live in Chicago!
 
•
I love to go the gym, play on a Esports Team for a video game called Valorant and love to play guitar here and there!

string.name: android_a_one
string.ul:
•
An operation system that lets a device and an end user to be able to interact with one another.
 
•
In case you did not know, an operating system is computer software that works to integrate hardware and software resources.

resources.string: What can we build with android?

string.name: android_a_two
string.ul:
•
Billions of devices around the world are being powered by the Android OS, from smartphones, watches, tablets and more!
 
•
In more structured environments, you are able to expand these devices and create something such as our POS which I will get into later.

resources.string: How to get started on android!

string.name: android_a_three
string.ul:
•
You can get started on using the Android OS by installing Android Studio, an IDE that allows you to use kotlin to code and use android.
 
•
Developer.android.com has many resources to begin!

string.name: kotlin_a_one
string.ul:
•
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that started its development in 2010.
 
•
In 2017, Kotlin was announced to be the official language for Android!

resources.string: Is there any prior experience needed for Kotlin?

string.name: kotlin_a_two
string.ul:
•
If you are a Java developer, you are in for a joy ride!
 
•
There are various resources to learn Kotlin, no prior experience necessary just as learning any new language.

resources.string: How can I get started on Kotlin?

string.name: kotlin_a_three
string.ul:
•
Thankfully, Kotlins developers have been so kind in providing various resources in starting!
 
•
There is also an article for the lazy Java developer byRenaud Cerrato.

string.name: xml_a_one
string.ul:
•
XML stands for eXtensible Markup Language
 
•
Allows you to describe data, in the case of Android, layouts!

resources.string: Where does XML come into play for Android?

string.name: xml_a_two
string.ul:
•
As mentioned above, XML allows us to create layouts for Android, a sort of UI interface!
 
•
There are various resources to learn Kotlin, no prior experience necessary just as learning any new language.

resources.string: How can I get started on learning XML?

string.name: xml_a_three
string.ul:
•
Specifically for Android learning, XML can be learned from various sources, one being LinkedIn!
 
•
Androids website also includes many videos and guides for the introduction to using XML for Android layouts!

string.name: binding_a_one
string.ul:
•
For some context, Android allows the user to interact between Kotlin or Java code and XML.
 
•
Before, developers used Kotlin synthetics and Java butter-knife, now we have View Binding!

string.name: binding_a_two
string.ul:
•
View Binding allows for easier code to be written for interaction between views.
 
•
Allows for safer way to reference XML layout views.

resources.string: How can I get started on implementing it correctly?

string.name: binding_a_three
git_a_one
string.ul:
\n•
Git is a software that allows for tracking of changes in any sets of files, usually used to collaborate among other software developers.\n

string.name: git_a_two
string.ul:
•
You have possibly heard of a repo which is short of repository.!
 
•
There are 2 types of repos, one being the remote repo. 
•
The remote repo is where code is stored on a code hosting service, Yum uses Gitlab or you may have also heard of Github! 
•
The local repo is where you have a copy of the remote repo locally on your machine, any changes made in the local repo will not affect the remote one.

resources.string: How do the remote and local repo interact?

string.name: git_a_three
string.ul:
•
To save any changes made on your local repo to the remote one, you need to commit your changes, which will save changes to the local repo.
 
•
To then save those changes onto the remote repo, you need to push your changes, which will save changes to the remote repo.

resources.string: What other terms are there in Git?

string.name: git_a_four
string.ul:
•
In Git, we also have branches and developing in branches and the interaction between branches, such as merging a branch, pulling a branch or rebasing
 
•
For the sake of time, we wont go over it, but will link a confluence power point made by my mentor, Erica, which explains everything in detail!
